Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "IJ56KL.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 14  # Page 15 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 0  # First rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Load", "Type", "Value"], ["Dead", "Uniform", "10kN/m"], ["Live", "Point", "5kN"]]
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1: Add first table on page 5, third rectangle
filepath = "current_drawing.pdf"  # Assuming default file name; not specified in instruction
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level: page 5 -> pagenumber = 4 (zero-indexed)
pagenumber = 4
# Order-level: third rectangle -> rectangleorder = 2 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 2

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
except Exception as e:
    # In case extraction fails due to invalid page or rectangle
    print(f"Failed to extract rectangle: {e}")
    rectangle = None

if rectangle is not None:
    # First table: Door dimensions
    argument1 = {
        "clip": rectangle,
        "data": [
            ["Door ID", "Width", "Height"],
            ["D01", "900mm", "2100mm"],
            ["D02", "1000mm", "2200mm"]
        ],
        "arrange": [None, None],  # Column widths and font to be auto-adjusted; no specific values given
        "font": None,  # "suitable font" is vague — not specified
        "fontsize": None  # Not specified
    }

    table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
        doc=doc,
        pagenumber=pagenumber,
        clip=argument1["clip"],
        data=argument1["data"],
        arrange=argument1["arrange"],
        font=argument1["font"],
        fontsize=argument1["fontsize"]
    )
    doc = table_adder1.addtable()

    # Second table: Window dimensions
    argument2 = {
        "clip": rectangle,
        "data": [
            ["Window ID", "Width", "Height"],
            ["W01", "1200mm", "1500mm"],
            ["W02", "1500mm", "1800mm"]
        ],
        "arrange": [[18, 18, 18], None],  # Row heights "appropriate" — assuming default; no exact values
        "font": None,
        "fontsize": None
    }

    table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
        doc=doc,
        pagenumber=pagenumber,
        clip=argument2["clip"],
        data=argument2["data"],
        arrange=argument2["arrange"],
        font=argument2["font"],
        fontsize=argument2["fontsize"]
    )
    doc = table_adder2.addtable()
else:
    # Record missing position due to failed extraction
    missing_information = '''file-level: current_drawing.pdf, page-level: 5, order-level: 3, base-level: incomplete - failed to extract rectangle'''
    recorder = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information)
    recorder.recording()

# Save updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)
